e4: While changing the policy might cause a short-term dip in share prices due to investor confusion, it is the ethically sound choice.  Truthful reporting builds long-term trust with investors, reduces legal risk, and ultimately strengthens the company's reputation and sustainability.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy above all else.  It presents a clear and unbiased picture of the company's financial performance, allowing investors to make informed decisions based on truthful data. Even when facing short-term market pressures, choosing honesty over manipulation builds trust and ultimately safeguards the long-term health of the company.
e6: Yes, I would ask management to develop a comprehensive communication plan for implementing the new policy. This plan should address how to educate investors about the change, clarify the reasons behind it, and manage potential market volatility during the transition.
